notes.requirement:
Aircraft are required t o con tact Mogadishu ACC at least 10min prior to the estimated time over t he​ en try point of the Mogadishu FIR; ​
Aircraft unable to make position reports​ direct to Mogadishu ACC shall request ground​ stations or​ other aircraft to relay the information
In case of VHF communication failure at Mogadishu ACC, all​ aircraft with the capability of Satellite​ communication are requested to contact Mogadishu ACC on SATCOM when transiting Mogadishu FIR.

notes.other:
SLOP is applied in t he ocean ic airspace of t he Accra F IR (AORRA)
Pilots may apply an offset out bound at the oceanic entry point and must return to centerline​ prior to​ the oceanic exit point.
ACFT transiting​ radar controlled airspace mid-ocean should remain on their already established offset​ positions.

notes.requirement:
Posit ion report ing is required at entry/exit gate as well as any other posit ion required by ATC:​
10°E, 0°E/W, 10°W, 20°W, 30°W, 40°W, 50°W
notes.other:
HF communication is required over large parts of the South Atlantic. The normal radiotelephone language in​ South America is Spanish. The ATC controller often works on several frequencies at a time and therefore a​ reply to a message may not be provided instantly. Especially in South America all ATC controllers should be​ dealt with carefully. ATC is not always according to ICAO standard.
Atlantico FIR does not require an HF SELCAL check after logon unless requested.
If any equipment is not operating normally, the pilot should notify ATC before entering the AORRA​ airspace.

notes.other:
OMC 12.3.7.8.1
Overflight of Iraq/Baghdad FIR
Approved Routes
Planned via L718, UM860, UM688 or published DCTs. Separation from the restricted areas will be ensured by ATC.
Minimum Flight Level
FL300 except during climb or descent.
Contingencies
In the event FL300 is not achieved due to ATC constraints, flight may enter the airspace and every effort shall be made to reach the minimum FL as soon as practicable.
In an emergency that requires immediate decision, the pilot-in-command, in the interest of safety, may deviate from these requirements to the extent required by that emergency.

notes.requirement: ACFT CREWS ENTERING TURKMENISTAN AIRSPACE FROM AIRSPACE OF AFGANISTAN AND IRAN SHALL ESTABLISH COMMUNICATION WITH TURKMENISTAN ATC UNITS AT 81-108NM BEFORE CROSSING FIR BOUNDARY

AIRCRAFT SHALL CROSS THE STATE BORDER THROUGH THE DESIGNATED TRANSIT CORRIDORS, UNLESS OTHERWISE AGREED WITH NEIGHBOURING STATES
IN CASE OF DIFFERENCE IN THE SEPARATION SYSTEMS ADOPTED IN KAZAKHSTAN AND NEIGHBOURING STATES, THE ACFT SHALL REACH AND MAINTAIN AN APPROPRIATE FL 30KM BEFORE ENTERING THE AIRSPACE OF REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN, UNLESS OTHERWISE ESTABLISHED BY AGREEMENTS BETWEEN ATC

AIRCRAFT SHALL CROSS THE STATE BORDER THROUGH THE DESIGNATED TRANSIT CORRIDORS, UNLESS OTHERWISE AGREED WITH NEIGHBOURING STATES
IN CASE OF DIFFERENCE IN THE SEPARATION SYSTEMS ADOPTED IN KAZAKHSTAN AND NEIGHBOURING STATES, THE ACFT SHALL REACH AND MAINTAIN AN APPROPRIATE FL 30KM BEFORE ENTERING THE AIRSPACE OF REPUBLIC OF KAZAKHSTAN, UNLESS OTHERWISE ESTABLISHED BY AGREEMENTS BETWEEN ATC

THE FLIGHT CREW MUST REPORT ITS FLIGHT NUMBER (RADIOTELEPHONE CALL SIGN, STATE AND REGISTRATION IDENTIFICATION SIGNS), POSITION, FLIGHT LEVEL (ALTITUDE) OF FLIGHT AND THE ESTIMATED TIME OF CROSSING THE STATE BORDER OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION TO THE APPROPRIATE ATSU AT LEAST 10 MIN BEFORE CROSSING THE STATE BORDER OF THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION
MINIMUM FLIHT LEVEL IS FL260 EXEPT FOR FLIGHTS TO AND FROM RUSSIAN DESTINATIONS

notes.requirement:
Perf﻿ormance-based Commun﻿icat﻿ion and Surveillance (PBCS) is applied in t﻿he Auckland Ocean﻿ic F﻿IR f﻿or t﻿he​ applicat﻿ion of reduced perf﻿ormance based separat﻿ion standards. ​
Requiremen﻿ts​
T﻿o be ​eligible ​f﻿or PBCS, all ACF﻿T must be equipped wit﻿h FANS 1/A and ​ achieve RCP 240 and RSP 180​ standards. ​ FANS 1/A​ aircraf﻿t n﻿ot​ meet﻿ing RCP 240 or RSP 180 may operate CPDLC and ADS-C in t﻿he​
Auckland Ocean﻿ic F﻿IR but will n﻿ot be eligible f﻿or PBCS. ​
T﻿he f﻿light crew must n﻿ot﻿ify ATC whenever t﻿he aircraf﻿t is n﻿ot PBCS complian﻿t due t﻿o equipmen﻿t failure. Aircraf﻿t operat﻿ing wit﻿hout SATCOM in t﻿he Auckland Ocean﻿ic F﻿IR do n﻿ot meet RCP 240 or RSP 180.
notes.other:
SLOP is applied in t﻿he Auckland Ocean﻿ic 

F﻿or ACF﻿T equipped wit﻿h t﻿he capacity t﻿o of﻿fset in ten﻿t﻿hs of a naut﻿ical mile randomly choose cen﻿terline or an​
of﻿fset posit﻿ion of 0.1NM up t﻿o a maximum of 2NM t﻿o t﻿he right of track.

When on uncharted (random) routes, ACF﻿T shall report posit﻿ion at in﻿tervals of 5° or 10° of LAT f﻿or​ predominan﻿t﻿ly n﻿ort﻿h-sout﻿h or LONG f﻿or predominan﻿t﻿ly east-west tracks. If t﻿he ACF﻿T traverses 10° in​ 80min or less, 10° shall be used. ​ ACF﻿T on diagonal ​ tracks shall ​ report at in﻿tervals n﻿ot ​ exceeding​ 80min.​
•​ F﻿or ACF﻿T f﻿lying on company generated uncharted routes (user preferred random route), all waypoin﻿ts​ published f﻿or t﻿hese routes are compulsory report﻿ing poin﻿ts except where t﻿hese waypoin﻿ts coincide​
wit﻿h published n﻿on-compulsory report﻿ing poin﻿ts or waypoin﻿ts on an ATS route.

notes.requirement:
OCR is implemented in all Oceanic airspaces except for Shanwick FIR. In these airspaces no Oceanic clearance will be issued. Instead, CPDLC
loadable route clearance uplinks will be used by ATC for any necessary route changes. RCL and other NAT HLA procedures remain unchanged
For additional information, refer to Lido Route Manual, LIDO GEN, RSI 2.3.5.1.1 "SpecialEmphasis Items for NAT Oceanic Clearance Removal".
